recipeName: Soft Great Instant Idlis By Kundhu
recipeDescription: Soft great instant idlis is a hassle free recipe to prepare idlis instantly. Simply mix the soft idli rava with eno and urad dal and then steam it into soft spongy idlis.
preparationMethod: Mix 1 cup of urad flour with 2 cups of soft idli rava.
Add a pinch of salt and keep it in a warm place for about 30minutes.
After 30 minutes, grease the idli plates
Add a teaspoon of eno to the above mixture.
Put it in the idli plates and steam cook for about 10minutes
Soft great idlis are ready !!!

recipeDescription: Summer Drink
preparationMethod: In a shaker, muddle cucumber, mint and honey syrup.
Then add the mango Puree, lemon juice and ginger Juice.
Cover with a lid and shake it very well.
Then add the ice and again Shake for 10 Seconds.
Strain in to a glass.
At last top it with soda water.
Serve immediately.

recipeDescription: A delicious drink for summers with tangy pineapple and spicy ginger!
preparationMethod: In a pitcher, combine the ginger ale and pineapple juice. Serve over ice with a piece of pineapple.
Serve chilled.

recipeDescription: A spicy and salty lassi. . . A must try!
preparationMethod: Combine the mint leaves, coriander leaves, ginger, green chillies, raw mango, salt, black salt and roasted cumin powder and blend in a mixer, adding a little water to a fine paste.
Add the curds,1 cup of water and ice cubes and blend again. Pour into individual serving glasses and serve chilled.

recipeDescription: The same recipe can be replaced by sev for a lovely and quick evening snack.
preparationMethod: In a glass bowl mix all the ingredients and serve immediately.
Serve with a hot beverage or any cold drink.

recipeDescription: Spicy Treat is a very refreshing and delicious drink to beat the summers heat.
preparationMethod: Mix curds and water and blend in a mixer for 2 minutes.
Add the beetroot, cucumber, green chilies, ginger, salt and crushed ice and blend again.
Heat ghee in a small pan, add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds. When the seeds crackle add to the prepared curd mixture.
Pour into serving glasses, sprinkle garam masala and garnish with mint leaves.
Serve chilled.

tag: Quick South Indian, Maharashtrian Rice Recipes
recipeDescription: Spinach and tomato rice is a tempting combination of spinach paste and tomato puree blended with rice. A colorful and tasty rice or pulao preparation which is even full of nutrition.
preparationMethod: Cook rice separately with pinch of salt & less water than usual.
Allow to cool.
For the gravy
Heat ghee in a kadai.
Add cummin,cloves,bayleaf.
When it sputters add onions & fry till brown.
Add tomato puree,ginger-garlic-green chilly paste & cook till ghee separates.
Add little water if puree is thick in the beginning.
Once cooked add spinach puree & cook for 5 mins.
Add salt to taste.
When gravy thickens turn off the flame & mix in the rice gently,separating the grains.
Garnish with coconut scrapings,ginger juliennes & serve hot

recipeDescription: This salad recipe is nutritious and helps increasing hemoglobin in the body.
preparationMethod: Mix all the ingredients in a bowl and serve chilled.

tag: Quick South Indian, Maharashtrian Rice Recipes
recipeDescription: Spinach and tomato rice brings out a colorful display on your table with chopped spinach and tomatoes added to the rice. The delicious and healthy rice recipe, spinach and tomato rice is full of flavour, aroma and an awesome taste.
preparationMethod: Heat ghee and stir fry the ginger slices for a while and saute the rice for a while.
Transfer all to the rice cooker and switch on.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper powder
recipeDescription: A delicious crunchy salad with a combination of spinach, fruits and nuts...simply delicious!
preparationMethod: Soak the raisins in little warm water for 5-10 mins, drain and keep aside.
combine all the ingredients in a bowl along with dressing and mix well.
Serve chilled.

recipeDescription: If lemon instead of keeping in the freeze open,are kept in a plastic container,they will remain good for long.
preparationMethod: Take all the sprouts in a bowl.
Put all the ingredients.miw well.
Garnish with coriander.
Your healthiest pure jhatpat indian nashta is ready to eat.

recipeDescription: Its best if served fresh.
preparationMethod: Mix all the sprouts.
To it add the tomotoes, grated carrot , onions and green chillies.
Now mix the chaat masala with salt and lime juice and keep aside.
Keep the sprouts mix and chaat mix in the fridge nad chill for an hour.
Just before serving mix the chaat mix with the sprouts mix and garnish with chooped corainder.

tag: Wholesome Salads (Salads that make a meal)
recipeDescription: A healthy, tasty and filling salad. This salad can also be used as a filling for wraps in wholemeal chapatis.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve immediately or chilled.

tag: Wholesome Salads (Salads that make a meal)
recipeDescription: 1.this salad tastes best when chilled. 2.do not use to many kind of sprouts.
preparationMethod: Mix togeather the sprouts,tomatoes,onion,cucumer.
Add the olives,gherkins,mint.keep refrigerated.
Just before serving add lemon juice,salt & pepper ,mix well & serve.

recipeName: Sprouty Peanut Tomato Rice In Microwave
recipeDescription: a delicious and quick rice delicacy made easily in microwave!
preparationMethod: Clean, wash and soak the rice in 2 cups of water for 30 minutes. Keep aside.
Put the peanuts, cumin seeds and onions in a microwave safe bowl and microwave on high for 4 1/2 minutes.
Add the turmeric powder, salt and garam masala, mix well and add sprouts, carrot, french beans and tomato puree, mix well and microwave on high for 3 minutes.
Add rice and enough water, mix well and cover with a microwave safe lid and microwave on high for 12 minutes.
Keep aside for 3 minutes.
Serve hot with curry of your choice.

recipeDescription: This is perfect mango dish, combination of mango pulp and rice rava. You can make rice rava in the house by soaking rice for 1 hour and then lightly dry in the shade and grind in the mixer.
preparationMethod: Take a bowl and mix the mango pulp and rice rava and keep aside for 1 1/2 hrs.
Add soda and put the mixture in to a greased pan and steam for 15 20 minutes into the steamer or cooker without whistle.
Then remove from the steamer and let it cool for some time then cut into pieces and serve.

recipeDescription: Prepare The South Indian style cooked Tamatar chutney with chopped tomatoes, garlic, salt and chillies. Find many tangy and sensational chutney recipes at tarladalal.com
preparationMethod: Roast the tomatoes and the green chillies separately on open flame (preferably over live coal or alternatively on gas flame) till done nicely.
Allow it to cool slightly. peel off the outer skins of both tomatoes and green chillies.
De-seed the chillies and chop. chop the tomatoes.
Roast cumin seeds on a griddle and powder it coarsely.
Mix tomatoes, green chillies with rest of the ingredients and grind coarsely.
Note : use the large variety of green chillies which are used for stuffed chilli dishes.

recipeDescription: Summer cool as the name suggests it gives much cooling effect which is the combination of pineapple juice, watermelon juice, sweet lime juice and rose syrup, and the colour combination also is very eye catching. so enjoy this summer cool.
preparationMethod: In a mixing bowl combine all the ingredients, stir well.
Pour into individual serving glass.
Serve chilled.

recipeDescription: An easy and healthy refreshing drink recipe.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients together in a mixer and blend till smooth.
Place ice-cubes into 2 individual glasses, pour the juice over it and serve immediately garnished with mint leaves.

recipeDescription: This is easy and fast to cook.
preparationMethod: Heat the ghee in a kadhai, add the onions and saute till they turn golden brown in colour.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the vegetables and tomatoes, mix well and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the garam masala, salt and chilli powder, mix well and cook till the vegetables are cooked.
Add the rice and mix well and saute for 3 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with mint.

recipeDescription: Easy to make.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Garnish with mint and ice and serve chilled.

recipeDescription: Palak chana dal, a delicious palak flavoured dal recipe. Serve with steamed rice.
preparationMethod: Blanch the spinach and grind to a fine puree. Keep aside.
Soak the dal for 2 hours, add the salt and turmeric powder, mix well and pressure cook for 3 whistle or till done.
Heat the ghee in a kadhai, add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds cracles add the green chilli paste, ginger-garlic paste and saute for a minute.
Add the onions, and saute till it turns to golden brown in colour.
Add the spinach puree, chilli powder, cooked dal, water as per required, garam masala, kasuri methi and salt, mix well and simmer for 5-8 minutes.
Serve hot, pour some ghee on top as per your choice.

recipeDescription: To avoid daily pills for controlling diabetes along with matching the lunch taste , sprouted methi salad serves to be a delicious dish for all my family members. Having all the daily salad components and the crux of methi, serves to be both healthy and tasty combination.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve chilled.

recipeDescription: A refreshing strawberry drink. Enjoy!
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a blender and blend till it is smooth.
Pour into 5 glasses and serve immediately.

recipeDescription: Techa is relished along with bhakri. can be enjoyed with rotis too !.
preparationMethod: Grind together all the above ingredients except the groundnuts. keep aside.
Grind the roasted groundnuts seperately.
Mix the groundnut powder to the above mixture and squeeze the juice of a lime and add salt.
Your techa is ready to be served.

recipeDescription: A cooling ‘thunder’ summer cooler -- refreshing as coconut water and as tasty as pineapple
preparationMethod: Chop pineapple slices and tender coconut malai roughly and bend along with little tender coconut water in the mixer till smooth paste.
Add the remaining ingredients and blend again till smooth.
Strain and refrigerate for 30-45 minutes.
Pour into 4 Martini Glasses and serve chilled garnished with lemon slice and mint leaves.

recipeDescription: This drink is tall, fun and extremely refreshing! Perfect for summer parties and BBQ's.
preparationMethod: Fill each Mason Jar half way with ice
Put 2 oz. of vodka in each jar
Put 6 oz. of juice on each jar
Secure lid and shake to combine
Enjoy from the jar served cold

recipeDescription: Tinda bhurta imparts a typical Indian style of rich cooking with tindas or small gourds. The roasted tindas are stir fried with onion-tomato paste,khoya and peas. A rich and spicy tinda vegetable dish which goes well with roti or Paratha.
preparationMethod: Lightly roast the tindas on a low fire till you can feel the spots on them..then put them in cold water, peel and mash coarsely.
Lightly brown the khoya in a dry pan.
Make a paste of the onion.
Heat the ghee and fry the onion paste and ginger to a golden brown colour.
Put the tomatoes, spices and salt and cook till the ghee comes to the top.
Add the peas and 1 cup of water.
Cook over a low flame till the peas are almost cooked.
Add the tindas and continue cooking till the peas are fully cooked.
After this add the khoya and keep on stirring until it blends well with the gravy.
Garnish with the coriander leaves and serve.

recipeDescription: People who enjoy paan can enjoy this chocolate.
preparationMethod: Melt the white chocolate in microwave for 30 secs.
Add the rest of the ingredients to the melted chocolate.
Mix well and pour into chocolate moulds and refrigerate for 5 minutes.
Take out from the moulds after 5 minutes and serve as mouth freshener.

recipeDescription: Two mild vegetables come to gather to create fiber rich, healthy, light and simple raita.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve fresh as is or after refrigerating it for an hour.
Before serving garnish it with cumin seeds powder and peanuts.
Serve it with khakra.

recipeDescription: A vegetable specialty preparation,palak makkai malai has makkai or corn kernels mixed with palak or spinach puree ,spices and cooked in a creamy(malai) rich gravy. Easy and yet a delicious recipe, which can be enjoyed with roti or parantha. .
preparationMethod: Combine the moong dal and spinach, turmeric powder, cloves, cinnamon powder, onions, ginger, chillies and 1 1/2 cups water and pressure cook for 2 whistles. Or till the dal is soft.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Heat 2 tbsp ghee in a pan, add the corn, spinach mixture, salt, amchur, garam masala and saute till the mixture becomes thick.
Add the cream and mix well.
Heat the remaining ghee in a small pan and add chilli powder and pour over the vegetables and mix well.
Serve hot with naan, roti, etc.

recipeDescription: Palak makkai malai matar makes for a tasty flavorsome vegetable dish in a rich creamy gravy. Palak makkai muttar is a tempting quick vegetable recipe with fresh and finely chopped palak or spinach leaves, peas, corn kernels, cream (malai) ,indian spice powders and green coriander leaves.
preparationMethod: Combine the moong dal and spinach, turmeric powder, cloves, cinnamon powder, onions, ginger, chillies and 1 1/2 cups water and pressure cook for 2 whistles. Or till the dal is soft.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Heat 2 tbsp ghee in a pan, add the corn, spinach mixture, salt, amchur, garam masala and saute till the mixture becomes thick.
Add the cream and mix well.
Heat the remaining ghee in a small pan and add chilli powder and pour over the vegetables and mix well.
Serve hot with naan, roti, etc.

recipeDescription: Add iron and calcium in your daily diet by serving the palak pulao. The spinach or palak puree is added to cooked rice to create the appealing and delicious palak pulao. The healthy, aromatic palak pulao recipe is quite easy to prepare and is typically relished with a cooling raita.
preparationMethod: Clean, wash the rice and drain the water and keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a pan, add the onions and saute till they turn pink.
Add the rice and saute for 5-10 minutes.
Add the spinach puree and saute for another 5-10 minutes.
Now add the ground paste, salt and enough water, mix well and cover and cook till rice are soft.
Serve hot.

tag: Babies, Toddler and Kids Iron Rich Foods
recipeDescription: A delicious raita made with palak which is filled with vitamin C and iron. Serve with pulav or parathas.
preparationMethod: Wash the palak leaves and cook them with very little water.
Retain the cooked water.
Saute jeera and pepper corns with half a teaspoon of ghee.
Grind this in a small mixi jar till it is powdered, add palak and the left over water and grind to a smooth paste.
Add the curds and salt .
This is a good combination with rice or with rotis.

recipeDescription: A unique paratha recipe with papad as one of its mixture ingredients, crunchy and crispy. Enjoy with aloo ki rasedar subzi or curd.
preparationMethod: Roast papad on stove.
Crush them in coarse powder.
Add pinch of salt, red chilli powder accoding to taste and a pinch of amchoor and1 tsp ghee, mix well and stuff the mixture in regular parantha dough and make like regular bharvan paratha.

recipeDescription: Here is papaya pina punch for this summer season, as the name suggests it is combination of papaya and pineapple and which is simple and easy too to prepare.
preparationMethod: In a bowl combine all the ingredients except ice and blend well using a hand blander.
Add the ice,stir well
Pour drink in each serving glass.
Serve garnished with scooped papaya balls.
Instead of pineapple, you can take orange or sweet lime with papaya, this combination also goes well.

recipeDescription: A tangy evening snack made of peanuts easy to make and enjoyable to eat.
preparationMethod: Take the peanuts in a bowl.
Add finely chopped onion, tomato, mint leaves, coriander and mix them
Add salt, chilli powder, chaat masala, green chutney and meetha and mix them.
Add a bit of lemon juice and mix well.
Garnish with finely chopped coriander and serve.
Peel and deseed the orange and seperate into segments.
Core the apple and chop into pieces.
Deseed the pear and chop.
Blend together the orange, apple and pear pieces.
Mix in the lemon juice, salt and pepper powder and blend again.
Serve chill.

recipeDescription: Pimms cup is a tempting cocktail recipe which is quite popular in Europe. The gin based alcoholic beverage, Pimms cup has strawberries mixed with ginger ale and lime juice or lime soda and served on a bed of crushed ice.
preparationMethod: In large pitcher, place strawberries, lemons, limes, and oranges.
Add pimm’s, and mash down lightly with a large spoon. may be made 3 to 4 hours ahead up to this point.
Fill each glass halfway with ice. add about 1/3 cup pimm’s mixture.
Fill glass with soda; stir. place cucumber spear in each glass; serve.

recipeDescription: If you have the time, then you can pour some of the pine apple juice in an ice tray and let it freeze to form ice cubes. thus while blending the ingredients only the remaining pineapple juice is to be added. the pineapple juice cubes can be added after blending. this keeps the drink chilled without diluting its flavour.
preparationMethod: Blend all the above ingredients in a blender or a mixie.
Serve chilled.

recipeDescription: A novel combination of pineapple with celery in the pineapple celery juice makes it not only a healthy choice but also a great summer drink.
preparationMethod: Combine the pineapple and celery with 2 cups of water and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Transfer in serving glasses, add the salt, mix well and serve chilled.

recipeDescription: Pineapple celery juice is a perfect combination of fiber rich celery with nutritious pineapple juice. Pep up the spice quotient of this healthy drink by adding a dash of lime juice and pepper powder. An amazing detoxifier, this celery and pineapple juice is good for weight watchers and health conscious people.
preparationMethod: Combine the pineapple and celery with 2 cups of water and liquidise till it becomes a purée.
Add the black salt and mix well.

recipeDescription: Vampire is an eye catching drink recipe prepared primarily from peeled and grated carrots. A powerhouse of nutrients, the vampire drink makes for a healthy and cooling summer drink.
preparationMethod: Pass the carrots and ginger through the juicer.
Add the lemon juice and stir well.
Serve chilled.

recipeDescription: Vangibath masala powder, this masala is added to add the flavour to the pulao's. You can refrigerate the masala powders this will last for many days.
preparationMethod: Dry roast all the ingredients separately, except the turmeric powder.
Combine all the ingredients along with turmeric in a blender and blend to a smooth powder.
Store in an airtight container, or bottle and use when required.
Store in frozen also it will be stay for a year.
Whenver you make rice finaly you will add this masala powder and mix well, cook and serve hot.

recipeDescription: Add sprite or 7up at the end so that u will get a nice foamy mock tail.
preparationMethod: Take vanilla icecream in a container in which you r going to make mocktail.
Try to make vanilla iceream into a liquidy form with the spoon.stir it.
Add orange juice.mix well
Add pineapple chunks and juice from the can and mix it well.
Last add sprite or 7 up and mix.
Your vanilla moctail is ready.serve it in tall glasses.

recipeDescription: Vanor is a cooling and reenergizing orange flavoured drink recipe with the vanilla icecream topped with chilled orange juice and served in a tall glass with orange segments as topping.
preparationMethod: Take 4 glasses add 1 big scoop vanilla ice-cream in each glass .
Add few pices of orange in each glass then add orange chill drink into each glass mix it .
Add orange slices & serve it chill.

tag: Popular Dals from all over India
recipeDescription: If dal is soaked in water for sometime it cooks faster.
preparationMethod: Soak toor dal in water for sometime and then pressure cook till done.
Cut onion potato and tomatoes vertically in stripes.

Heat ghee in a vessel. add black pepper,cloves and dalchini then add onion and potato. fry till potato is cooked. then and tomatoes and fry again. add red chillie powder and fry again .finally add cooked dal. put water as per the consistancy like any dal. add salt as per taste. garnish with corriender.

recipeDescription: If you like you can add garlic and ginger paste with tomato. It will give nice taste and flavour both.
preparationMethod: Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes. Drain it.
Cut all vegetables in lengthwise.
Heat the ghee in a non-stick kadhai, add the cumin seeds, cloves and cardmom, saute it on a medium flame.
When it turns slightly brownish, add the tomatoes and all spices and salt and saute for 2 minutes.
Add all the vegetables, saute it for 5 minutes.
Add the rice and the required quantity of water, cover it and cook it for 15 minutes or till the rice is done.
Serve hot garnish with coriander.

recipeDescription: A tasty and healthy preparation of mixed blanche vegetables in a sauce od various condiments and pineapple juice and cashewnuts.
preparationMethod: Soak cashewnuts in half cup of water for fifteen minutes.
Drain and grind to a paste using the pineapple juice.
Heat ghee in a pan.
Add ginger paste, garlic paste, pepper powder and green chillies.
Sauté for a minute. add pineapple and cashewnut paste, cinnamon powder, salt and blanched vegetables.
Cook for two minutes.
Serve hot garnished with chopped coriander.

recipeDescription: You can add a bit of ghee if you like .
preparationMethod: Finely chop the carrots.
In a pressure cooker put rice,
Dal and above mentioned vegetables.
Add the water ,salt ,turmeric powder ,cloves and cinnamon to the rice and dal.
Pressure cook it for 5 to 7 minutes.
Allow the cooker to cool down.
Pour the hot yummy khichdi in a bowl
Garnish it with corriander leaves.
Serve while hot.

recipeDescription: A delicious vegetable gravy made with various vegetables, dal and sambhar powder.
preparationMethod: Wash all the vegetables and cut them length wise.
Mix vegetables and tuvar dal and cook in pressure cooker till 2 whistles.
Dry roast the ingredients for masala (except coconut) and then grind the masala. keep aside.
Once the vegetables and cooked, place it in a pan and add the ground masala.
Add salt and allow it to cook for 10 minutes.
Add curry leaves and lemon juice.

recipeDescription: If preferred one can fry the patties instead of baking.
preparationMethod: Make a soft dough mixing both the flours, and salt. cover and keep aside.
Heat little ghee in a kadhai. add jeera.
Add panifal, peas, salt and pepper powder. mix well.
Cover and let it simmer in slow flame until half cooked.
Cool the mixture.
Make balls of the dough and roll the balls into 1/8" thin roti.
Put little fillings in the middle. apply little water at all sides and fold it half.
Twist the sides. brush ghee all over. arrange in greased baking sheet.
Preheat the oven and bake the patties at 350 degree f for 15 mins.
Serve with chutney or kadhi.

recipeDescription: a refreshing watermelon based drink..
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Strain and refrigerate till chilled.
Serve chilled.

recipeDescription: This salad is tangy, tasty and colourful. Just try it...
preparationMethod: In a bowl, take white beans, beetroot, spring onions, tomatoes and mix well.
Add ground paste to it and mix well.
Garnish with roasted sesame seeds.
Serve chilled.

recipeDescription: This ganesh festival..make these delicous laddoos..
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Take 3 tsp of mixture and make ladoos with light hand.
Roll them up in a dry coconut powder and keep aside.
Serve then garnished with tender rose petals.
Serve soft fresh ladoo at room temperature with almonds.

recipeDescription: Whole meal salad offers a complete healthy meal option with vegetables, paneer and fried wheat rotis or tortillas added all together in one dish. Season the whole meal salad with tempered mustard seeds and curry leaves and you would have a healthy, tasty and quick meal recipe on the table.
preparationMethod: Cut all the leafy vegetables into thin strips.
Chop the other vegetables into small pieces.
Cut the fresh paneer into small pieces.
Mix the lemon juice to it.add the salt and pepper.
Just before serving mix the fried tortilla or the fried chapatti pieces to it. decorate with few leaves of celery or parsley or coriander.

recipeDescription: This is a very healthy and fast cooking recipe. eat hot with raita or pappads
preparationMethod: Wash and soak rice for 1/2 hour.
Meanwhile cut all the vegetables.
In a microwave bowl put the soaked and drained rice, add all the ingredients , mix with a fork. add 1 and 1/2 cups of water.
Cover and cook for 12 minutes.
Keep for 5 minutes and then fluff with a fork , decorate with fresh corriander leaves and serve hot with pumpkin pachadi

recipeDescription: Zesty Boldly Mary is a tangy cocktail with tomato puree and vodka. Perfect party during for those above 18.
preparationMethod: Combine tomato juice,tomato puree, vodka, worcestershire sauce, lime juice, and tabasco sauce in a 2-quart pitcher; stir well.
Serve over ice.
Garnish with lime or celery.

recipeDescription: Methi mangori presents a delicious way of adding wholesome nutrition in the form of moong dal mangodi , methi leaves and beaten curd. A spicy recipe, the mangodis are cooked with methi or fenugreek leaves in a tangy curd based gravy.
preparationMethod: Sieve the besan and ad the curds and whisk well.
Steam the mangori by either putting them in microwave for 3-4 minutes or by steaming them in idli steamer. Keep aside.
Cook besan mixture on high flame, adding 2 cups water tillthe mixture becomes thick.
Add the salt, steamed mangodis and methi, mix well and cook on a slow flame for about 20-25 minutes, stirring in between.
Meanwhile, heat the ghee in small pan and add the asafoetida and red chilli powder and pour this on methi mangori.
Serve hot with rice.

recipeDescription: A delicious dal palak recipe with a blend of tuar dal along with chopped palak or spinach leaves. The fiber rich, iron dense and calcium rich dal palak are cooked with palak leaves and tempered with mustard and cumin seeds. The tasty dal palak is flavored with tomatoes, chili powder and jeera powder. Simply delicious!
preparationMethod: Wash and soak the moong in enough water for a couple of hours.
Drain and keep aside.
Heat 1 tbsp ghee in a kadhai, add the onions and saute till the onions turn translucent.
Add the ginger and garlic, mix well and saute till they turn soft.
Add the remaining ingredients along with dal and little water and mix well.
Cover tightly and cook on a sloe flame till the dal is becomes soft and quite dry.
Remove from flame, add 5 tbsp of ghee over top before serving.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: A minty tongue tickling drink..
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Pour it in all tall glasses with ice cubes.
Garnish with cucumber rings or cucumber stick.

recipeDescription: Idli as all know is made from urad dal and rice or rava. But here is idli which is made from mix dal i. E chana dal, moong dal and urad dal. This is something different type of idli which is soaked in water, drained off and served with sweet curd.
preparationMethod: Combine the dals and blend in a mixer to a smooth paste.
Transfer to bowl, add the salt and ginger-green chilli paste and mix well.
Just before making, add the fruit salt and mix gently.
Put 2-3 tsp of batter in greased idli mould.
Steam in an idli steamer for 10-12 minutes.
Un-mould and dip the idlis in little lukewarm water for 2 minutes. Squeeze out the excess water
Arrange the idlis in serving plate, pour sweet curds on idli, sprinkle salt, chast masala and chili powder.
Serve immediately.

recipeDescription: For extra antioxidants, try this Bircher recipe with added berries.
preparationMethod: Mix the oats and apple juice until well combined, in a large container with a well-fitting lid.
Place in the fridge and leave for at least 1 hour or until all the juice has been absorbed (preferably overnight).
Just before you are ready to eat, grate the apple.
Add the grated apple and yoghurt to the oat and juice mixture.
Serve with berries and honey if desired.

recipeDescription: Try this novel way to enjoy your cereal, full of nutrients.
preparationMethod: Put all the ingredients in the blenderor food processor
Blend for half minute.
Taste and sweaten with honey, chill and serve.

tag: Popular Dals from all over India
recipeDescription: Discover the wonderful taste of different dals in this mixed dal recipe. The lentils ad to the texture of this dal recipe and can be enjoyed with both rice and roti.
preparationMethod: Put all the dals in a bowl,keep it in a bowl by adding water for 15mins.
Cook dal in pressure coooker..
Heat the ghee in a kadai.
Add mustard and cumin seeds
Add green chilli and garlic paste
Pink the garlic paste
Add all the spices
Now add cooked dal.
Sprinkle the corriander leaves and serve.

recipeDescription: Note: this mixed fruit can be kept under refrigerator and serve chilled.
preparationMethod: Cut all the fruits in cube shape.
Then take a big bowl in which tang/rasna,sprite & fanta is poured.
After that take all the fruits and dipped it into the sprite mixture.
Leave it in that condition for ten minutes.
Serve in a bowl.

recipeDescription: In these Scorching heat, Pine pom will refresh you with its naturally soothing effect. Its a complete family drink with ample of nutritional effect. Enjoy Pine pom at any time of the day.
preparationMethod: Combine the pomegranate juice,pineapple juice, mint leaves, salt and ice cubes and blend in a mixer.
Pour into 4 individual glasses and top with soda.
Serve immediately.
